message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.ST, cs.DS 

This paper is about the sample complexity of large-margin classification, which is a fundamental problem in machine learning. The paper introduces a new quantity called the \gamma-adapted-dimension, which is a function of the spectrum of a distribution's covariance matrix. The paper provides distribution-specific upper and lower bounds on the sample complexity, which hold for a rich family of sub-Gaussian distributions. This work is relevant to several areas of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), statistics (cs.ST), and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
